src:
9月出口出现3年来最大跌幅 马股涨幅受限
04 Nov 2019, 05:07 by Surin Murugiah
（吉隆坡4日讯）由于我国9月出口出现3年来最大跌幅，马股涨幅相对较小，徘徊在1600点下方。
休市时，富时隆综指起4.78点，报1598.12点，盘中曾扬至1600.65点。
我国9月出口按年下跌6.8%，至777亿令吉，进口则增长2.4%。9月贸易总额为1471亿令吉，较一年前下跌40亿令吉或2.7%。
上升股276只、下跌股250只，另有536只无起落。成交量有14亿4000万股，值8亿6587万令吉。
主要上升股包括Nestle (M) Bhd、Petronas Dagangan Bhd、Hartalega Holdings Bhd、Apollo Food Holdings Bhd、Carlsberg Brewery Malaysia Bhd、ViTrox Corp Bhd、KESM Industries Bhd、Time Dotcom Bhd、Malaysian Pacific Industries Bhd和Top Glove Corp Bhd。
热门股有Sapura Energy Bhd、Sumatec Resources Bhd、Prestariang Bhd、Bumi Armada Bhd、Uzma Bhd、Velesto Energy Bhd和DGB Asia Bhd。
下跌股则有Hong Leong Bank Bhd、Aeon Credit Service (M) Bhd、British American Tobacco (M) Bhd、United Plantations Bhd、Fraser & Neave Holdings Bhd、Country Heights Holdings Bhd、Oriental Holdings Bhd、Muhibbah Engineering (M) Bhd和G3 Global Bhd。
路透社报道，亚洲股市周一劲扬至逾14周高位，因对于中美贸易谈判的乐观情绪越发浓厚，且美国就业数据表现上佳，提高全球投资者的风险偏好。
MSCI明晟亚太地区（除日本）指数跳涨1%，触及7月25日以来最高。
肯纳格投资银行研究指出，综指上周五跌4.64点或0.29%，以1593.34点挂收。
“从图表上看，基本趋势依然看跌，因综指低于100天简单移动平均线（SMA），加上随机指标的超买信号，我们相信综指可能继续下行。”
该研究机构表示，支撑水平可能见1550和1510点，而阻力位为1630和1650点。
（编译：陈慧珊）

English version：
KLCI gains stay limited as Sept exports show biggest fall in 3 years

Via theedgemarkets.com
text:
September's exports showed the biggest decline in three years.
04 Nov 2019, 05:07 by Surin Murugiah
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 4): The Malaysian stock market has seen a relatively small increase in its three-year decline in September, hovering below 1600 points.
At the time of the market, the FTSE KLCI closed at 4.78 points, at 1598.12 points, and it was raised to 1600.65 points.
China's exports in September fell by 6.8% year-on-year to RM77.7 billion, while imports increased by 2.4%. The total trade volume in September was RM147.1 billion, down RM4 billion or 2.7% from a year ago.
There were 276 rising stocks and 250 falling stocks, and another 536 had no ups and downs. The trading volume was 1.44 billion shares, valued at RM865.57 million.
Major rising stocks include Nestle (M) Bhd, Petronas Dagangan Bhd, Hartalega Holdings Bhd, Apollo Food Holdings Bhd, Carlsberg Brewery Malaysia Bhd, ViTrox Corp Bhd, KESM Industries Bhd, Time Dotcom Bhd, Malaysian Pacific Industries Bhd and Top Glove Corp Bhd.
Popular stocks include Sapura Energy Bhd, Sumatec Resources Bhd, Prestariang Bhd, Bumi Armada Bhd, Uzma Bhd, Velesto Energy Bhd and DGB Asia Bhd.
Falling stocks include Hong Leong Bank Bhd, Aeon Credit Service (M) Bhd, British American Tobacco (M) Bhd, United Plantations Bhd, Fraser & Neave Holdings Bhd, Country Heights Holdings Bhd, Oriental Holdings Bhd, Muhibbah Engineering (M) Bhd And G3 Global Bhd.
Reuters reported that Asian stock markets rose to a high of more than 14 weeks on Monday, as optimism about Sino-US trade negotiations became more intense, and US employment data performed well, raising the risk appetite of global investors.
MSCI's Asia Pacific (excluding Japan) index jumped 1%, hitting its highest since July 25.
Kenanga Investment Bank Research pointed out that the KLCI fell 4.64 points or 0.29% on Friday, with a gain of 1593.34 points.
"From the chart, the basic trend is still bearish. As the KLCI is below the 100-day Simple Moving Average (SMA) and the overbought signal of the Stochastic, we believe the KLCI may continue to move."
The research institute said that support levels may see 1550 and 1510 points, while resistance levels are 1630 and 1650 points.
(Compile: Chen Huishan)

English version:
KLCI gains stay limited as Sept exports show biggest fall in 3 years

Via theedgemarkets.com
